fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend

Class SubSolution<T extends fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.SubSolutionReactivesAccessor>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.SubSolution<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - A SubSolutionReactivesAccessor object: it has to be either SubSolution or SubSolutionElements.

    public final class SubSolution<T extends fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.SubSolutionReactivesAccessor>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements SubSolutionReactivesAccessor and is part of a recursive structure constructed from SubSolution and SubSolutionElements objects. The parameterized type of this class has to be one of those two types.
    This class is meant to be used as attribute (i.e as reactive) in an implementation class of ReactionRule, in order to specify that the reaction rule needs reactives that are in an inner solution.
    For example, to find elements in a sub solution, use SubSolution<SubSolutionElements>; and to find elements in a sub-sub-solution, use SubSolution<SubSolution<SubSolutionElements>> as attribute in a reaction rule class.
    All the functions of this class execute a simple recursive call. For example, this.getElements() is return this.parameterized_type.getElements().
    Author:
    Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubSolution

        public SubSolution(T e)
        Builds a SubSolution object, with the specified SubSolutionReactivesAccessor implementation object.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getElements()
        Returns the set of elements/reactives - if the desired types were found in the inner solution. This method is meant to be called by the user in ReactionRule.computeResult() or ReactionRule.computeSelect().
        Returns:
        the set of elements/reactives corresponding to the types specified with setTypeList(List).

      • getTypeList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> getTypeList()
        Returns the type list, the list of the types of the desired reactives. This function is meant to be called internally (not by the user), in order to know the desired types of reactives.
        Returns:
        the list of types

      • setElements

        public void setElements(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> l)
        Sets the elements/reactives, when found. This method is used internally.
        Parameters:
        l - the list of elements/reactives found.

      • setTypeList

        public void setTypeList(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> l)
        Setter for the type list. This type list correspond to the desired reactives in the any inner solution, and it is set by the user in the constructor of its reaction rule class.
        Example of parameter for this function: if you want to request an integer, a string and an instance of the class "MyObject", you should call this function with the following parameter.
        List l = new LinkedList();
        l.add(Integer.class, String.class, MyObject.class);
        Parameters:
        l - The list of types, specified by the user.

      • getSolution

        public Solution getSolution()
        Getter for the concerned inner solution. Returns the inner solution in which the elements are. Meant to be used by the user.
        Returns:
        The inner solution containing the selected reactives.

      • setSolution

        public void setSolution(Solution s)
        Setter for the concerned solution. Meant to be used internally (not by the user), in order to set the solution in which the reactives are found (if they were found).
        Parameters:
        s - The concerned solution
